title: D.A.R.E logo brush script
content:
What’s used for the official D.A.R.E. Drug/Violence Program logo? [http://www.dare.com/home/default.asp](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924092614/http:/www.dare.com/home/default.asp "http://www.dare.com/home/default.asp")  
The original is in red. Speedline (too much flourish) and Challenge Extra Bold (too clean) are underneath for comparison. It’s also not Buffalo Joe.  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeart/buffalo-joe/regular/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924092614/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeart/buffalo-joe/regular/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeart/buffalo-joe/regular/")  
If this has been answered before, apologies, but search doesn’t seem to work for me, and acronyms never work.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [dare-font-comparisons.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924092614/http:/typophile.com/files/dare-font-comparisons.gif) | 2.58 KB |

 [‹ Coldwell Banker PREVIEWS - need PREVIEWS font identified](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924092614/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34001 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Cascade" unicase serif face - Eidetic {Scott Dasse} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924092614/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34031 "Go to next forum topic")
author: btdump

comments.content:
All of the periods are different. This was probably drawn by hand with an actual brush.

- Lex

I think Lex is right, but if I were re-creating the logo I think I’d oblique [Brody](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924092614/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/brody/) and maybe try to add some extra brush strokes to the left, and some ’distressing’ to make the brush effect more exaggerated.

- Mike Yanega
